Other tests that we have failed in ways that could be fixed by this PR:

1. core/zookeeper_security_upgrade_test.py
2. core/reassign_partitions_test.py
3. core/throttling_test.py
4. core/upgrade_test.py
5. core/security_rolling_upgrade_test.py

I started a build with repeat=8 for zookeeper_security_upgrade_test.py: https://jenkins.confluent.io/job/system-test-kafka-branch-builder-2/247/

I'll do the same for the other 4 tests above.

Also, we have a nightly job running system tests on this branch:

https://jenkins.confluent.io/job/system-tests-kafka-kip-101/

As expected, the PR build is not reliable. I've just updated a comment to trigger a new build and now two out of three pass. So we had (3/3 -> 1/3 -> 2/3)

Please accept, I need the client-lib to work in an OSGi environment.
@mjsax there are some differences in the test from trunk. E.g., there is no method shouldOnlyReadForEarliest here while it exists in trunk. Could you summarize in 1-2 sentences? Thanks.
LGTM, merged to trunk.
This is just missing the latest update to the trunk PR, which I just merged. Once @mjsax updates this PR, I'll merge it.

@eno: I have trouble to build this PR locally:

```
$ ./gradlew installAll

Building project 'core' with Scala version 2.10.6
:install_2_10
Building project 'core' with Scala version 2.10.6
:kafka:clients:compileJava UP-TO-DATE

Total time: 1.28 secs
```
I'm checking. Works for me with trunk and this branch.
@ijuma Cherry-picked the new test from `trunk`.

I just updated this.

Thinking about this twice, I am still not sure if the code is 100% correct. IMHO, the decoupling of the `do { ... } while (numPartitionsNeeded);` loop and the call to `ensureCopartitioning()` afterwards is super hard to reason about.

I don't have time right now, but I think we should rewrite this part of the code and also add more tests... Don't think it's urgent because it's not a hot problem though.

@junrao When it comes to security issues like this one, the default position should be to backport unless there's a reason not to. It's true that there is a workaround, but people may not realise that they have to do it until it's too late.
I'd like to see it in 0.10.2 unless there is special complication in cherry-picking.
Merged to 0.10.2. Can you please close the PR?
Thank you!!!! Will try tomorrow morning :)

Test PASSed (JDK 8 and Scala 2.12).

There seem to be some issues with this PR, see attached DEBUG logs from the Kafka Music app, running against the latest code in this PR.

Order of events was:

1. App started with no topics in the cluster.  `metadata.max.age.ms` set to 1s.
2. I created the first of the two input topics, named "play-events". (The second topic wasn't created yet.)
3. The next metadata request (metadata version 47) was sent, leading to the discovery of the "play events" topic:

```
[2017-04-06 23:49:30,901] DEBUG [kafka-music-charts-dc2813de-bf62-4cb8-8d07-dd64d31bdf70-StreamThread-1] Sending metadata request (type=MetadataRequest, topics=<ALL>) to node 1 (org.apache.kafka.clients.NetworkClient)
[2017-04-06 23:49:30,904] DEBUG [kafka-music-charts-dc2813de-bf62-4cb8-8d07-dd64d31bdf70-StreamThread-1] Updated cluster metadata version 47 to Cluster(id = XGN88L2eTzikZ1vIFa3s2A, nodes = [192.168.99.100:29092 (id: 1 rack: null)], partitions = [Partition(topic = play-events, partition = 1, leader = 1, replicas = [1], isr = [1]), Partition(topic = play-events, partition = 0, leader = 1, replicas = [1], isr = [1]), Partition(topic = play-events, partition = 3, leader = 1, replicas = [1], isr = [1]), Partition(topic = play-events, partition = 2, leader = 1, replicas = [1], isr = [1])]) (org.apache.kafka.clients.Metadata)
```

Eventually, what happened was that the app run into a `TopologyBuilderException`, which complained that the *second* input topic was not (yet) found:

```
Exception in thread "kafka-music-charts-dc2813de-bf62-4cb8-8d07-dd64d31bdf70-StreamThread-1" org.apache.kafka.streams.errors.TopologyBuilderException: Invalid topology building: stream-thread [kafka-music-charts-dc2813de-bf62-4cb8-8d07-dd64d31bdf70-StreamThread-1] Topic not found: song-feed
```

Details below.

On the positive side, the app startup seems to be better:  After the app has started (and before any topics have been created), REST-querying `/kafka-music/instances` returns `[{"host":"localhost","port":7070,"storeNames":[]}]` with this PR, instead of `[]` before for Streams version 3.2.0.

<details>
<pre>
<code>
[2017-04-06 23:49:29,894] DEBUG [kafka-music-charts-dc2813de-bf62-4cb8-8d07-dd64d31bdf70-StreamThread-1] Sending metadata request (type=MetadataRequest, topics=<ALL>) to node 1 (org.apache.kafka.clients.NetworkClient)
[2017-04-06 23:49:29,897] DEBUG [kafka-music-charts-dc2813de-bf62-4cb8-8d07-dd64d31bdf70-StreamThread-1] Updated cluster metadata version 46 to Cluster(id = XGN88L2eTzikZ1vIFa3s2A, nodes = [192.168.99.100:29092 (id: 1 rack: null)], partitions = []) (org.apache.kafka.clients.Metadata)
[2017-04-06 23:49:30,021] DEBUG [kafka-producer-network-thread | kafka-music-charts-dc2813de-bf62-4cb8-8d07-dd64d31bdf70-StreamThread-1-producer] Sending metadata request (type=MetadataRequest, topics=) to node 1 (org.apache.kafka.clients.NetworkClient)
[2017-04-06 23:49:30,025] DEBUG [kafka-producer-network-thread | kafka-music-charts-dc2813de-bf62-4cb8-8d07-dd64d31bdf70-StreamThread-1-producer] Updated cluster metadata version 23 to Cluster(id = XGN88L2eTzikZ1vIFa3s2A, nodes = [192.168.99.100:29092 (id: 1 rack: null)], partitions = []) (org.apache.kafka.clients.Metadata)
[2017-04-06 23:49:30,394] DEBUG [kafka-coordinator-heartbeat-thread | kafka-music-charts] Sending Heartbeat request for group kafka-music-charts to coordinator 192.168.99.100:29092 (id: 2147483646 rack: null) (org.apache.kafka.clients.consumer.internals.AbstractCoordinator)
[2017-04-06 23:49:30,396] DEBUG [kafka-music-charts-dc2813de-bf62-4cb8-8d07-dd64d31bdf70-StreamThread-1] Received successful Heartbeat response for group kafka-music-charts (org.apache.kafka.clients.consumer.internals.AbstractCoordinator)
[2017-04-06 23:49:30,901] DEBUG [kafka-music-charts-dc2813de-bf62-4cb8-8d07-dd64d31bdf70-StreamThread-1] Sending metadata request (type=MetadataRequest, topics=<ALL>) to node 1 (org.apache.kafka.clients.NetworkClient)
[2017-04-06 23:49:30,904] DEBUG [kafka-music-charts-dc2813de-bf62-4cb8-8d07-dd64d31bdf70-StreamThread-1] Updated cluster metadata version 47 to Cluster(id = XGN88L2eTzikZ1vIFa3s2A, nodes = [192.168.99.100:29092 (id: 1 rack: null)], partitions = [Partition(topic = play-events, partition = 1, leader = 1, replicas = [1], isr = [1]), Partition(topic = play-events, partition = 0, leader = 1, replicas = [1], isr = [1]), Partition(topic = play-events, partition = 3, leader = 1, replicas = [1], isr = [1]), Partition(topic = play-events, partition = 2, leader = 1, replicas = [1], isr = [1])]) (org.apache.kafka.clients.Metadata)
